segments.text: I notice the woman’s foot is already in the puddle, but she’s not reacting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s like she’s in her own world, completely unaware.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are so focused on the cookies, they don’t see the danger either.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel bad for her—she’s going to be shocked when she finally notices.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is going to ruin her shoes and the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is so close to falling, and no one is there to catch him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting, not realizing how risky this is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish someone would step in and help before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene makes me feel a little helpless.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope everything turns out okay for them.
segments.speaker: PAR
